sysevent_email_action.description: when approval generated in form 2 approval
sysevent_email_action.message_html:
Kia ora ${approver},


BS11 Assessment ${number} is awaiting your approval for Form 2. Click here (link) to review and approve/reject the assessment for:

${URI_REF}


The BS11 Assessment indicates that steps to make the service compliant have been completed. If you choose to approve the assessment, your approval confirms the items set out below for your role for this service.


If you are the Business Contact or Business Owner, approval confirms:

The Business Contact and Owner are responsible for the risks associated with the services they outsource, including compliance with the BS11 Outsourcing Policy as required by Kiwibank’s conditions of registration as a bank.


Your approval confirms:

1. I have reviewed the BS11 Assessment in ServiceNow.

2. The information in the Assessment is correct, including the information which will form part of the RBNZ Compendium.

3. The BCP and DR arrangements are regarded as sufficient to maintain the service within the required timeframes for the Outcome.

4. I understand that I will ensure that all relevant information is entered into the BS11 Compendium within 15 days off this approval and I will review the accuracy of that entry. Once approved, the Business Contact should liaise with the Operational Risk and Compliance team member re entry of the arrangement into the BS11 Compendium.


If you are the Operational Risk and Compliance team member

The Operational Risk and Compliance team advise the Business Contact and Owner. Your approval confirms:

1. I have reviewed the BS11 Assessment in ServiceNow and discussed the arrangement as necessary.

2. The Assessment shows that the function or service is not within the scope of BS11, and this assessment seems reasonable.


If you are the Operational Risk and Compliance team member

The Operational Risk and Compliance team advise the Business Contact and Owner. Your approval confirms:

1. I have reviewed the BS11 Assessment in ServiceNow, and discussed the arrangement as necessary.

2. The Compendium and PCT information is supported by the evidence provided, and appears reasonable.

3. The BC and DR assessment provides a reasonable explanation of how Kiwibank is satisfied that the arrangements are sufficient to maintain the service.

4. I will enter the relevant information into the BS11 Compendium within 15 days off this approval.
